events.headline: OpenAI Launches GPT-4 API
events.description: OpenAI released GPT-4, the most capable large language model at the time. Set the benchmark for frontier model pricing at $30/MTok input and $60/MTok output for the 8K context version.
events.impact: Established the pricing standard for frontier-class models. 32K context version priced at $60/$120.
events.notes: 8K context version. 32K context was $60/$120 per MTok.

events.headline: Anthropic Launches Claude 2 with 100K Context
events.description: Anthropic released Claude 2.0 with an industry-first 100K token context window, dramatically exceeding the 32K limits of competitors at the time.
events.impact: First major model with 100K context. Priced significantly below GPT-4 at 73% less for input tokens.
events.notes: 100K context window was groundbreaking when GPT-4 maxed at 32K.

events.headline: OpenAI Launches GPT-4 Turbo with 66% Price Cut
events.description: OpenAI released GPT-4 Turbo at DevDay, featuring 128K context and prices slashed to $10/$30 per MTok - a 67% reduction for input and 50% for output.
events.impact: Massive price disruption. Made GPT-4-class models accessible to many more developers. 128K context became the new standard.
events.notes: DevDay 2023 announcement. Also introduced vision capabilities.

events.headline: OpenAI Cuts GPT-3.5 Turbo Prices by 50%
events.description: OpenAI reduced GPT-3.5 Turbo pricing with 50% cut on input tokens and 25% on output tokens, alongside fixing the 'lazy GPT-4' issue.
events.impact: Made efficient-tier models even more cost-effective. Signaled aggressive pricing competition.
events.notes: Also introduced new embedding models at this time.

events.headline: Anthropic Launches Claude 3 Family with Three Tiers
events.description: Anthropic released the Claude 3 family with three tiers: Opus ($15/$75), Sonnet ($3/$15), and Haiku ($0.25/$1.25). First multi-tier model family with clear capability/price tradeoffs.
events.impact: Established the tiered model approach that became industry standard. Opus beat GPT-4 on many benchmarks.
events.notes: Opus pricing shown. Sonnet: $3/$15, Haiku: $0.25/$1.25. 200K context window.

events.headline: OpenAI Launches GPT-4o with 50% Price Cut from GPT-4 Turbo
events.description: OpenAI released GPT-4o (omni), a natively multimodal model with 50% lower prices than GPT-4 Turbo. Native audio and vision capabilities built in.
events.impact: Continued aggressive price erosion. Multimodal capabilities at frontier prices set new bar for model value.
events.notes: Later reduced further to $2.50/$10. 'Omni' = multimodal native.

events.headline: Google Launches Gemini 1.5 Flash for High-Volume Use Cases
events.description: Google launched Gemini 1.5 Flash, a lightweight model optimized for speed and cost efficiency. Designed for high-volume, high-frequency tasks with 1M token context.
events.impact: Undercut GPT-3.5 Turbo pricing while offering longer context. Established Google's competitive position in efficient tier.
events.notes: 1M context window. Later received 78%/71% price cuts in August 2024.

events.headline: Anthropic Launches Claude 3.5 Sonnet at Sonnet Price
events.description: Anthropic released Claude 3.5 Sonnet with Opus-level capabilities at the Sonnet price point ($3/$15). 2x faster than Claude 3 Sonnet with significant quality improvements.
events.impact: Disrupted value equation - flagship-quality at mid-tier price. Became one of the most popular API models.
events.notes: Same price as Claude 3 Sonnet but with Opus-level quality. Introduced Artifacts feature.

events.headline: OpenAI Launches GPT-4o Mini at $0.15/$0.60
events.description: OpenAI released GPT-4o Mini, their most cost-effective model. At $0.15/$0.60 per MTok, it's 60% cheaper than GPT-3.5 Turbo while outperforming it on benchmarks.
events.impact: Massive disruption to efficient tier pricing. Made GPT-4-class quality accessible at sub-$1/MTok prices.
events.notes: Replaced GPT-3.5 Turbo as the recommended efficient model.

events.headline: Google Slashes Gemini 1.5 Flash Prices by 78%
events.description: Google announced a massive 78% reduction in input costs and 71% reduction in output costs for Gemini 1.5 Flash, making it one of the cheapest capable models available.
events.impact: Set new floor for efficient-tier pricing. Aggressive response to GPT-4o Mini launch.
events.notes: Prompts <128K tokens only. Part of tuning rollout.

events.headline: OpenAI Launches O1 Reasoning Models
events.description: OpenAI released O1-preview and O1-mini, new 'reasoning' models that use chain-of-thought to solve complex problems. O1-preview priced at $15/$60, O1-mini at $3/$12.
events.impact: Created new 'reasoning' tier above frontier. Higher prices but significantly better on math, science, and coding tasks.
events.notes: O1-mini is $3/$12. O1-preview later superseded by full O1 in December.

events.headline: Google Reduces Gemini 1.5 Pro Prices by 64%
events.description: Google announced 64% input and 52% output price reductions for Gemini 1.5 Pro, effective October 1st. Also increased rate limits by 2-3x.
events.impact: Made Gemini 1.5 Pro competitive with Claude 3.5 Sonnet on price while offering 2M context window.
events.notes: Prompts <128K only. Released alongside Gemini-1.5-Pro-002 and Flash-002.

events.headline: Anthropic Releases Upgraded Claude 3.5 Sonnet
events.description: Anthropic released an updated Claude 3.5 Sonnet with improved capabilities and introduced 'computer use' - the ability to operate computers via screenshot and mouse/keyboard control.
events.impact: Maintained price while improving quality. Computer use feature opened new automation possibilities.
events.notes: Also released Claude 3.5 Haiku at $1/$5 per MTok. Computer use in beta.

events.headline: OpenAI Releases Full O1 Model
events.description: OpenAI released the full O1 model (o1-2024-12-17), replacing O1-preview. 34% reduction in major errors on difficult problems compared to preview.
events.impact: Solidified reasoning model tier. Also announced $200/month ChatGPT Pro with O1 Pro mode.
events.notes: Part of '12 Days of OpenAI' event. O1 Pro API later at $150/$600.

events.headline: Google Launches Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental
events.description: Google released Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental as part of the Gemini 2.0 launch. Native tool use, multimodal generation, and real-time streaming capabilities.
events.impact: Next-generation multimodal capabilities at efficient-tier pricing. Free tier available during experimental period.
events.notes: Experimental pricing. Production pricing may differ.

events.headline: DeepSeek V3 Launches at $0.14/$0.28 per MTok
events.description: DeepSeek released V3, a 671B parameter MoE model (37B active), with frontier-class capabilities at a fraction of competitor pricing. Trained for ~$6M vs $100M+ for comparable models.
events.impact: Shattered price expectations for frontier-class models. 95% cheaper than GPT-4-class alternatives.
events.notes: MoE architecture with 671B total / 37B active parameters.

events.headline: DeepSeek R1 Launches at $0.55/$2.19 per MTok
events.description: DeepSeek released R1, a reasoning model matching O1 performance at 20-50x lower cost. Became the #1 app on iOS App Store within a week.
events.impact: Triggered $600B market cap loss in tech stocks on Jan 27. Proved frontier reasoning possible at dramatically lower costs.
events.notes: Open weights released. Market impact was unprecedented.

events.headline: Anthropic Launches Claude 3.7 Sonnet with Extended Thinking
events.description: Anthropic released Claude 3.7 Sonnet, featuring extended thinking capabilities for complex reasoning. Maintains Sonnet pricing while adding reasoning features.
events.impact: Brought reasoning capabilities to Sonnet tier without price increase. Competitive response to O1 and R1.
events.notes: Extended thinking uses separate thinking token budget.

events.headline: Anthropic Launches Claude Opus 4.5
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.5, their most capable model featuring improved reasoning, coding, and creative capabilities at the Opus price point.
events.impact: Reclaimed frontier position from GPT-4.5 and DeepSeek. Extended thinking available.
events.notes: Same pricing as Claude 3 Opus with significantly improved capabilities.
